snippet.title: Dropbox grows leadership team with Condoleezza Rice
snippet.description: At first glance, it seems like an unusual choice. But the cloud storage service is trying to grow its international presence, which is something a former US Secretary of State should know how to do.

snippet.title: Sony Action Cam HDR-AS30V
snippet.description: Joining the AS30V's new hardware features are a new waterproof housing and several accessories and mounts, bringing it closer to the competition.

snippet.title: Pinterest amps up recipe search with new filters
snippet.description: The social network adds dietary filters and the ability to search by ingredients.

snippet.title: Dropbox: Condoleeza Rice appointment won't alter privacy pledge
snippet.description: Responding to criticism over the former US Secretary of State joining its board, CEO Drew Houston says Rice understands Dropbox's stance on privacy, fully supports "our commitments to our users."

snippet.title: Smartphone talks to Panasonic rice cooker
snippet.description: Japanese market to get a rice cooker from Panasonic that is controllable by a smartphone.

snippet.title: Walmart buys recipe startup to pair with online grocery delivery
snippet.description: In its quest to tackle the online grocery delivery market and bulk up its Walmart To Go service, the retail giant snaps up the recipe-minded Yumprint.

snippet.title: Pinterest acquires recipe sharing Punchfork
snippet.description: The social site makes its first purchase, choosing the food recipe bookmarking network.

snippet.title: Codlo: Rice cooker sous vide gadget is affordable, stylish
snippet.description: The Codlo on Kickstarter aims to make sous vide cooking affordable and as simple as hooking the kitchen gadget up to a rice cooker.

snippet.title: Acer warns Microsoft that hardware is like 'hard rice'
snippet.description: The Taiwanese PC maker compares computer manufacturing to food as it again criticizes Microsoft for making the Surface tablet, according to a report.

snippet.title: Ex-49er Jerry Rice says big data ups fantasy football competition
snippet.description: If you're one of the 25 million people who play fantasy football, be prepared to do some number crunching. Fans now have access to more stats than ever before. A panel of experts including NFL Hall of Famer Rice discuss how technology is changing the game.
